history.content:
You've taken 61A & 70? And gotten an A or better in both of them? Well shucks dude, I'd say you're in a better position than some students who come as Intended CS majors; give yourself some credit. 90% of people applying to these clubs are in the same boat as you. As far clubs, I've also heard Codebase is a great organization but I wouldn't exactly say it not competitive. There are tons of CS clubs on campus -- you can in fact, check out every registered technology oriented club here: https://callink.berkeley.edu/organizations?categories=5120. 

Some other popular ones I've heard personally are Codeology, Blueprint, and Launchpad. 

_____________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Pioneers in Engineering is a STEM outreach nonprofit that builds a robotics competition for local high schools. It believes in STEM education accessibility, there's no experience required and no application process. All backgrounds and majors are welcome, and you are welcome to decide your own time commitment.  The last infosession is today (free pie), but we have a Welcome Week all next week! https://www.facebook.com/pierobotics/

Well shucks dude, I'd say you're in a better position than some students who come as Intended CS majors; give yourself some credit. 90% of people applying to these clubs are in the same boat as you. There are tons of CS clubs on campus -- you can in fact, check out every registered technology oriented club here: https://callink.berkeley.edu/organizations?categories=5120. 

Some other popular ones I've heard personally are Codeology, Blueprint, and Launchpad.

children.subject: Definitely check Codeology! Wouldn't say it's not competitive but I highly encourage to apply.

history.content: So I'm a rising sophomore who only took 61A and 70 (got good grades though: A+ and A), because I decided to major in CS rather late. I have no experience in networking with CS people, and want a not-so-competitive club or stuff to join in to have some experience in projects and stuff. I heard Codebase is generally nice for ppl w/o experience. But any other recommendations? Thanks in advance!
history.subject: Easy entry level clubs to join?
